🛡️ Sovereign AI Compliance Framework

Trustworthy and reliable AI operation through systematic compliance

What is Sovereign AI?

A Sovereign AI is a system that governs its own access to resources, tools, and capabilities based on a set of immutable, verifiable, and transparent protocols. It is designed to be robust, secure, and aligned with its operational and ethical directives.

The Five Pillars of Compliance

🛡️

Security

Guardian Protocol

Protect system integrity, resources, and user data from threats

🔐

Privacy

Vault Protocol

Strict data compartmentalization with scoped, temporary access

⚖️

Ethics

Ethics Protocol

Operate within defined ethical framework with measurable alignment

👁️

Transparency

Visual Reasoning

Real-time observable and interpretable reasoning processes

🤔

Uncertainty

Grounding Protocol

Quantify uncertainty and act with proportional caution

🛡️

Pillar 1: Security (Guardian Protocol)

System integrity and threat protection

Implementation Components

  • • Authentication Layer: All agents must register before system interaction
  • • Security Monitoring: Real-time network monitoring and threat response
  • • Integrity Monitoring: Health checking of core components
  • • Dynamic Response: Automated blocking of suspicious activity

Core Services

  • • Sentinel System: Primary gatekeeper and authentication
  • • Security Engine: AI-driven firewall and threat detection
  • • Guardian Service: Meta-service monitoring core components
🔐

Pillar 2: Privacy (Vault Protocol)

Data compartmentalization and access control

Access Control

  • • Secure Enclave: Encrypted storage for sensitive data
  • • Scoped Access: No direct access to raw secrets
  • • Temporary Credentials: Time-limited, narrowly-scoped access
  • • Audit Trail: Complete logging of access requests

Implementation

  • • Cognitive Vault: Secure data enclave
  • • Mediated access through Sentinel verification
  • • Credential provisioning based on task requirements
⚖️

Ethics Protocol

  • • Formal ethical guidelines
  • • Quantifiable ethical scoring
  • • Continuous compliance assessment
  • • Capability restrictions for low scores
👁️

Visual Reasoning

  • • Mandatory state broadcast
  • • Human-interpretable interfaces
  • • Real-time reasoning transparency
  • • Complete decision traceability
🤔

Grounding Protocol

  • • Mandatory uncertainty self-assessment
  • • Threshold-based capability control
  • • Uncertainty-grounded decisions
  • • Continuous uncertainty broadcasting
